acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It carried out the outside of Category from 96-hour LC50=704mg/L of fishes (Fathead minnows) (ECETOC TR91, 2003).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on rabbit LDLo value (IUCLID (2000); 12400 - 22700 mg/kg), LD50 value is guessed as 5000mg/kg or more.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Rat LC50 value >878ppm (IUCLID (2000)) was presupposed to be vapor test from saturation steam pressure (1049 - 1293ppm). But it cannot be classified since LC50 value was unspecified.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale:
SPECIES: Rat
ENDPOINT: LD50
VALUE: 2.06 g/kg
REFERENCE SOURCE: ACGIH (2001)

aspiration_hazard.rationale: Not classified because of the dynamic viscosity: 24.6 mm2/s at 40C.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since not water-insoluble (aqueous solubility =42000 mg/L (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)) and acute toxicity is low.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the negative result in a somatic cell in vivo mutagenicity test (micronucleus examination), we classified it as Out Of Category according to the technical guideline.

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) and the oxygen is chemically bonded only to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements).

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Since although the bad influence (the increase in mortality rate and growth inhibition of child) to future-generations was observed in the mouse studies, effect on parent animals were unknown (ACGIH (2001)), it was classified into Category 2.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid (melting point <= 140degC) substances are not available.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Since four in the four animals in the animal tests, the scores of Corneal opacity after 24, 48 or 72 hours are 3 respectively, and in which the one animal has not recovered from the disorder after 21 days (ECETOC TR48 (2), (1998)). So it was set as Category 1.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It was classified as Category 3 based on the statement of "only slightly irritant to the rabbit skin" (ACGIH (2001) and Patty (5th, 2001)).

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Although a result of human patch test  of skin sensitization is shown in Patty (5th, 2001), since its details are unknown, it cannot be classified.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement:
Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (dust inhalation)
May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver, kidney)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 (autonomic nervous systems) according to that (ACGIH, 2001) autonomic nervous disorders was seen in humans. Moreover, since slight degeneration in liver and kidney were observed in the dosage of a guidance value of Category 2, it was classified into Category 2 (liver, kidney).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 3 Respiratory tract irritation, Narcotic effects
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation, narcotic effects)
May cause drowsiness or dizziness (respiratory tract irritation, narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Since respiratory irritation (Patty (5th, 2001)) and anaesthetic (ACGIH, 2001) were seen, respectively, it is classified into Category 3 (respiratory irritation, anaesthetic).
